at0000.1.description: A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
Образец заголовка раздела
Un encabezado de sección de tipo genérico que será renombrado en una plantilla para su empleo en un contexto clínico específico.
Naslov sekcije
En generisk seksjonsoverskrift som skal gis nytt navn i en templat for å passe i en gitt klinisk kontekst.
Um cabeçalho de sessão genérico que deve ser renomeado no template para adequar-se a um contexto clínico específico.
En allmän avsnittsrubrik som döps om i en openEHR-mall för att passa in i en specifik klinisk kontext.
Eine generische Abschnittsüberschrift eines Templates, welche entsprechend dem spezifischen klinischen Kontext umbenannt werden sollte.
Un'intestazione di sezione generica che dovrebbe essere rinominata in un template per adattarsi ad uno specifico contesto clinico.
Un en-tête de section générique qui doit être renommé dans un modèle pour s'adapter à un contexte clinique spécifique.

de.purpose: *To record a summary of vaccine administration events targeting a single infectious disease or agent, or a group of infectious diseases or agents that are vaccinated simultaneously using a combination vaccine. (en)
de.use:
*Use to record a summary of vaccine administration events targeting a single infectious disease or agent, or a group of infectious diseases or agents that are vaccinated simultaneously using a combination vaccine.

The intent of this archetype is to support a clinical determination about whether the individual is up-to-date with vaccinations for the targeted disease/s or agent/s. It is not intended to make a determination about the immunisation status, which is about whether the individual has developed an adequate immune response following vaccination or whether protective immunity has waned. 

This archetype does not presume any particular schedule or protocol for immunisation. (en)
de.misuse:
*Not to be used to record the vaccination status of an individual at a point in time - use OBSERVATION.vaccination_status for this purpose. 

Not to be used for documenting the detailed administration of a vaccine, including body site, route, manufacturer and batch number etc - use ACTION.vaccination or ACTION.medication for this purpose.

Not to be used for recording screening question/answer pairs regarding vaccination activity - use OBSERVATION.vaccination_screening for this purpose. (en)

es-ar.purpose: *To record a summary of vaccine administration events targeting a single infectious disease or agent, or a group of infectious diseases or agents that are vaccinated simultaneously using a combination vaccine. (en)
es-ar.use:

at0052.1.comment: The vaccine name may contain a generic or trade name for a vaccine, the name of a combination vaccine, or a category of vaccine. For example: Measles vaccine; Measles Mumps Rubella (MMR) or 'Measles-containing vaccine'. Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible.

at0003.1.description: Status of the primary (or catch up) course of vaccinations.
at0003.1.comment: This status should be revised if the course has not been completed and the 'Next vaccination due' date or 'Next review due' has passed.

at0009.1.description: The date when the most recent vaccine was administered.
at0009.1.comment: Can be a partial date, for example, only a year.

at0049.1.description: Additional narrative about vaccination administrationfor the identified disease or agent, not captured in other fields.

at0000.1.description: Summary of vaccination administration for a single infectious disease or agent, or a group of infectious diseases or agents that are vaccinated simultaneously using a combination vaccine.

author.name: Alan March
author.organisation: Hospital Universitario Austral, Pilar, Buenos Aires, Argentina.

author.name: Adriana Kitajima, Débora Farage, Fernanda Maia, Laíse Figueiredo, Marivan Abrahão

de.purpose: *To record a summary of vaccine administration events targeting a single infectious disease or agent, or a group of infectious diseases or agents that are vaccinated simultaneously using a combination vaccine. (en)
de.use:
*Use to record a summary of vaccine administration events targeting a single infectious disease or agent, or a group of infectious diseases or agents that are vaccinated simultaneously using a combination vaccine.

The intent of this archetype is to support a clinical determination about whether the individual is up-to-date with vaccinations for the targeted disease/s or agent/s. It is not intended to make a determination about the immunisation status, which is about whether the individual has developed an adequate immune response following vaccination or whether protective immunity has waned. 

This archetype does not presume any particular schedule or protocol for immunisation. (en)
de.misuse:
*Not to be used to record the vaccination status of an individual at a point in time - use OBSERVATION.vaccination_status for this purpose. 

Not to be used for documenting the detailed administration of a vaccine, including body site, route, manufacturer and batch number etc - use ACTION.vaccination or ACTION.medication for this purpose.

Not to be used for recording screening question/answer pairs regarding vaccination activity - use OBSERVATION.vaccination_screening for this purpose. (en)

author.name: Alan March
author.organisation: Hospital Universitario Austral, Pilar, Buenos Aires, Argentina.

author.name: Adriana Kitajima, Débora Farage, Fernanda Maia, Laíse Figueiredo, Marivan Abrahão

de.purpose: *To record a summary of vaccine administration events targeting a single infectious disease or agent, or a group of infectious diseases or agents that are vaccinated simultaneously using a combination vaccine. (en)
de.use:
*Use to record a summary of vaccine administration events targeting a single infectious disease or agent, or a group of infectious diseases or agents that are vaccinated simultaneously using a combination vaccine.

The intent of this archetype is to support a clinical determination about whether the individual is up-to-date with vaccinations for the targeted disease/s or agent/s. It is not intended to make a determination about the immunisation status, which is about whether the individual has developed an adequate immune response following vaccination or whether protective immunity has waned. 

This archetype does not presume any particular schedule or protocol for immunisation. (en)
de.misuse:
*Not to be used to record the vaccination status of an individual at a point in time - use OBSERVATION.vaccination_status for this purpose. 

Not to be used for documenting the detailed administration of a vaccine, including body site, route, manufacturer and batch number etc - use ACTION.vaccination or ACTION.medication for this purpose.

Not to be used for recording screening question/answer pairs regarding vaccination activity - use OBSERVATION.vaccination_screening for this purpose. (en)

de.purpose: *To record a summary of vaccine administration events targeting a single infectious disease or agent, or a group of infectious diseases or agents that are vaccinated simultaneously using a combination vaccine. (en)
de.use:
*Use to record a summary of vaccine administration events targeting a single infectious disease or agent, or a group of infectious diseases or agents that are vaccinated simultaneously using a combination vaccine.

The intent of this archetype is to support a clinical determination about whether the individual is up-to-date with vaccinations for the targeted disease/s or agent/s. It is not intended to make a determination about the immunisation status, which is about whether the individual has developed an adequate immune response following vaccination or whether protective immunity has waned. 

This archetype does not presume any particular schedule or protocol for immunisation. (en)
de.misuse:
*Not to be used to record the vaccination status of an individual at a point in time - use OBSERVATION.vaccination_status for this purpose. 

Not to be used for documenting the detailed administration of a vaccine, including body site, route, manufacturer and batch number etc - use ACTION.vaccination or ACTION.medication for this purpose.

Not to be used for recording screening question/answer pairs regarding vaccination activity - use OBSERVATION.vaccination_screening for this purpose. (en)

at0052.1.comment: The vaccine name may contain a generic or trade name for a vaccine, the name of a combination vaccine, or a category of vaccine. For example: Measles vaccine; Measles Mumps Rubella (MMR) or 'Measles-containing vaccine'. Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible.

at0003.1.description: Status of the primary (or catch up) course of vaccinations.
at0003.1.comment: This status should be revised if the course has not been completed and the 'Next vaccination due' date or 'Next review due' has passed.
